clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Rosiglitazone on Pre-Diabetes Mellitus and Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Rosiglitazone Treatment and Secondary Prevention of Cardiovascular Events in Patients With Pre-Diabetes Mellitus and Coronary Artery Disease

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives:
The investigators examined whether rosiglitazone, a thiazolidinedione (TZD), is beneficial for pre-diabetes mellitus (DM) adults with documented coronary artery disease (CAD).
Background:
Microvascular and macrovascular complications are common in type 2 DM. There is no evidence about the effects of TZDs, synthetic peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor (PPAR)-Î³ activators (insulin sensitizers and adipose transcriptional regulation and anti-inflammatory process activators) on pre-DM patients with documented CAD.

detailed_description.textblock:
Materials and Methods:
This is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study, patients will be randomly assigned to the TZD group and to the placebo group with a 6-month treatment period.
Biomarkers will also examined before and 6 months post-treatment during the trial.
The primary end-points will be the diagnosis of major cardiovascular events: myocardial infarction, overt heart failure, and surgery or coronary intervention for CAD.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: major cardiovascular events, including myocardial infarction, overt heart failure, and surgery or coronary intervention for CAD
primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 6 months follow-up of MACEs
primary_outcome.description: Primary end points: The primary end-point was defined as major cardiovascular events, including myocardial infarction, overt heart failure, and surgery or coronary intervention for CAD.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Biomarkers were taken before the trial and 6 months later
secondary_outcome.description: Resistin and adiponectin will be measured to evaluate insulin resistance; CCL/MCP-1 and hsCRP were also analyzed to evaluate inflammation status changes. Several vascular associated remodeling markers and proteins will also be measured.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- documented CAD by angiography
- insulin resistance or glucose intolerance
- 18 to 80 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- under DM treatment
- allergy to TZD
- active inflammation
- chronic disease under NSAID treatment
- active heart failure
- unwilling or unable to sign inform consents
